doc.field: Barry and Gloria Garfinkel collection of photographs
Barry and Gloria Garfinkel collection of photographs
This collection consists of 39 black and white photographs by various photographers. The photographs date from 1946-1974, and feature portraits of prominent people and New York City street scenes.
This collection consists of 39 black and white photographs by various photographers. The photographs date from 1946-1974, and feature portraits of prominent people and New York City street scenes.

This collection consists of 39 black and white photographs by various photographers, including Victor Laredo, Fritz Henle, Arnold Eagle, Jill Freedman, Bruce Davidson, Jerry Lang, N. Jay Jaffee, Fons Ianelli, Fred McDarrah, Ken Regan, Ron Galella, and Arthur Leipzig. The photographs date from 1946-1974. Some photos feature portraits of prominent people, such as Truman Capote, Bella Abzug, John Cassavetes, and Diane Keaton. Other photos capture New York City street scenes, including police officers on the beat, children playing, iconic buildings, and views in Central Park.
Gift of Barry and Gloria Garfinkel, 2017.
